definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: About 100 copies of the first Action Comics issue remain.
sentences.chinese: 《动作漫画》的创刊号在全世界仅剩约100本。

sentences.english: The first number of the pictorial leaped straight to success.
sentences.chinese: 画报的创刊号一举成功。

sentences.english: Opening number refer to newspapers and periodicals begin first issue that publish formally.
sentences.chinese: 创刊号是指报刊正式开始刊行的第一期。

sentences.english: The opening number is the documents and materials never out of date.
sentences.chinese: 创刊号是永远不会过时的文献资料。

sentences.english: 1889 - The first issue of the Wall Street Journal is published.
sentences.chinese: 1889年的今天，《华尔街日报》创刊号发行。

sentences.english: This is our first issue, and it may or may not meet your expectations.
sentences.chinese: 本季刊之创刊号能否符合你的期望呢？

definition: to start publishing/to found a journal
a series of books/a collection of books
